data.title: Kd-match: Correspondences of objects between two catalogs through pattern matching
data.name: kd-match

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "Both finding the matching triangles and later the matching objects in the catalogues require finding neigh- bours in a two-dimensional space. If the space were one dimensional, one would use a binary "

The README describes an astronomy-specific algorithm and method for matching catalogues of objects, indicating it is a domain research code rather than a generic library: "Finding the correspondances between catalogues of objects has long been a goal of astronomy."

The text focuses on the scientific method and algorithmic approach (triangle and quadrilateral matching, k-d trees) used in astrometry, implying the software directly implements research analysis: "This algorithm dramatically speeds the search over the two dimensions, and runs the search for the astrometry.net algorithm (Lang et al. 2010)."
